V bližini Jelšan prijeli tihotapce ljudi
04 Nov 2019, 18:52 by STA

Hrvaška policija je v soboto zaradi suma poskusa tihotapljenja ljudi v Slovenijo prijela tri britanske državljane. Enega so ovadili tudi zaradi suma napada na uradno osebo, ker je z avtomobilom zapeljal proti policistu, je danes potrdila hrvaška policijska uprava na Reki.



Foto: Wikipedia

REKA > Policisti so v soboto zvečer med rednim nadzorom meje s Slovenijo nedaleč od mejnega prehoda Jelšane opazili sumljivo vozilo, ki je bilo parkirano ob cesti. Ko so nameravali preveriti identiteto voznika, je 31-letni Britanec s pospešeno hitrostjo zapeljal proti policistu z očitnim namenom, da bi mu preprečil opravljanje policijskih nalog in ga poškodoval, je danes na svoji spletni strani objavila primorsko-goranska policijska uprava.
Policist se je vrgel na tla in se izognil drvečemu vozilu, voznika pa so potem prijeli pri poskusu vstopa v Slovenijo. Povezali so ga še z dvema Britancema, ki sta prav tako v soboto zvečer v kombiju skušala čez mejo prepeljati več tujih državljanov.
Vsi trije so sedaj v priporu zaradi suma tihotapljenja ljudi. Agresivnega voznika so ovadili tudi zaradi napada na policista. Enega od aretiranih pa bodo privedli pred sodnika za prekrške, ker so pri njem našli manjšo količino kokaina, so še sporočili s policije.

People smuggling in the vicinity of Jelsan
04 Nov 2019, 18:52 by STA

Croatian police arrested three British citizens on Saturday on suspicion of attempting to smuggle people into Slovenia. One was also accused of suspicion of assaulting an official for driving a car against a police officer, the Croatian Police Administration in Rijeka confirmed today.



Photo: Wikipedia

RIVER> On Saturday evening, police officers observed a suspicious vehicle parked along the road during a regular border check with Slovenia not far from the Jelsana border crossing. A 31-year-old British man, speeding to check the identity of the driver, rushed toward the police officer with the apparent intention of preventing him from performing police duties and injuring him, the Primorje-Gorski Kotar Police Department announced on its website today.
The policeman threw himself on the ground and avoided the tree-lined vehicle, and the driver was then arrested when trying to enter Slovenia. He was also linked to two Britons, who also sought to transport more foreign nationals across the border on Saturday night.
All three are now in custody on suspicion of human smuggling. The aggressive driver was also accused of assaulting a police officer. One of those arrested will be brought before a misdemeanor judge because they found a small amount of cocaine with him, police said.
